pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:5.1: 6. The second training rule on well-restrained
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas, playing with their hands and feet. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:7.2: “‘I will sit well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should be well-restrained.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area, playing with his hands and feet, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:9.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:10.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
